critical_gap.title: Website & Digital Presence Deficit
critical_gap.description: Despite a strong sales organization (confirmed by CRO), Peak Technologies' website fails to effectively communicate value proposition, differentiation, and customer proof points. The site presents dual messaging confusion (managed services vs. transformation partner), lacks quantified customer outcomes, and provides no clarity on the Zebra partner relationship vs. direct sales. With 18 acquired companies, the brand architecture lacks integration. For a $121.9M business serving Fortune 500 customers, the absence of named customer logos, case studies with metrics, or industry-specific solution pages represents a significant credibility gap.
critical_gap.notes: Employee sentiment (Glassdoor 3.1/5) noted in research but not highlighted as critical gap per user feedback—only employee issues directly related to GTM excellence (e.g., CMO turnover) should be elevated

key_findings.title: Website & Digital Presence Deficit
key_findings.summary: Website lacks clarity on value proposition, customer proof points, and brand integration. Creates unnecessary sales friction despite strong internal sales team.

key_findings.title: Brand Portfolio Confusion
key_findings.summary: 18 acquisitions create brand architecture complexity. Unclear if sub-brands represent distinct offerings or integrated solutions. Market positioning muddled.

key_findings.title: Customer Proof Point Deficiency
key_findings.summary: Minimal public proof points despite Fortune 500 customer base. No named logos, quantified case studies, or ROI metrics visible.

key_findings.title: Competitive Positioning Ambiguity
key_findings.summary: Zebra Premier Partner positioning lacks clarity on when prospects should choose Peak vs. Zebra direct. Category ownership undefined.

quick_hits.title: Homepage Hero Clarity
quick_hits.description: Pick ONE primary value proposition for the hero section. Either lead with 'ROI-driven managed mobility services' OR 'digital transformation partner'—not both. Create separate landing pages or clear navigation for the secondary positioning.

quick_hits.title: Add Customer Logos
quick_hits.description: Display 5-10 recognizable customer logos on the homepage (with permission). If logos aren't available, add 'Trusted by Fortune 500 companies in retail, manufacturing, and healthcare' with specific vertical callouts.

quick_hits.title: Publish One Quantified Case Study
quick_hits.description: Take your best customer relationship and create a 300-word case study with ONE quantified outcome (e.g., '47% reduction in device downtime' or '$450K annual savings'). Get customer approval and publish prominently on the homepage.

quick_hits.title: Create 'Why Peak vs. Zebra Direct?' FAQ
quick_hits.description: Add a dedicated page or section explaining when customers should choose Peak implementation vs. Zebra direct sales. Address the ambiguity head-on with clear positioning.

immediate: Clarify Zebra partner positioning with explicit buyer guidance
Develop unified homepage messaging (choose primary positioning)
Identify 5-8 customer references for case study development
short_term: Create category ownership narrative beyond 'largest provider'
Segment messaging by vertical and buyer type
Build brand architecture strategy for acquired portfolio
long_term: Brand architecture strategy for sub-brand portfolio
Analyst relations strategy for market validation
Website optimization roadmap with conversion tracking

upgrade_potential.full_diagnostic_value: High - significant commercial gaps with clear improvement paths
upgrade_potential.estimated_score_lift: 15-20 points achievable in 6 months with focused execution (61 → 76-81)
upgrade_potential.notes: Sales team is strong (68/100). Focus should be on marketing and digital presence to support strong sales execution.
